presentation.fsa
Class Edge

java.lang.Object
  presentation.fsa.GraphElement
      presentation.fsa.Edge
All Implemented Interfaces:
PresentationElement
Direct Known Subclasses:
BezierEdge, InitialArrow
public abstract class Edge
extends GraphElement

The abstract description of data and behaviours common to all edges that represent transitions and initial arrows in the graphical display.

Author:
Helen Bretzke

Edge

public Edge(Node source,
            Node target)
Creates an edge adjacent on the source and target nodes with no abstract transition. NOTE No default transition is created since this edge gets its Id from its first transition.

Parameters:
source - the source node
target - the target node
Method Detail

createExportString

public abstract String createExportString(Rectangle selectionBox,
                                          int exportType)
Creates a string that contains an appropriate (depending on the type) encoding of this edge.

Parameters:
selectionBox - The area being selected or considered
exportType - The export format
Returns:
String The string representation
See Also:
GraphExporter.INT_EXPORT_TYPE_EPS, GraphExporter.INT_EXPORT_TYPE_PSTRICKS

intersectionWithBoundary

public abstract Point2D intersectionWithBoundary(Node node,
                                                 int type)
Computes an approximation to the point where this edge intersects the boundary of node. Returns the first point between midpoint of the edge and centre of Node with given type where this edge intersects the boundary of node, null if no intersection exists. NOTE more than one intersection is possible (e.g. reflexive edges and curved edges with multiple crossings).

Parameters:
node -
type - SOURCE or TARGET
Returns:
the first point between middle of edge and centre of Node with given type where this edge intersects the boundary of node, null if no intersection exists.

setHandler

public void setHandler(EdgeHandler handler)
Sets the handler for this edge with handler. Replace the current edge handler (if exist) with the handler.

Parameters:
handler -
